memberdef.name: BotAndItemPlacementNote
memberdef.initializer: = "While playing, press Q and A to add/remove Bots. Press W and S to add/remove Items."

memberdef.name: BotAndItemGenerationNote
memberdef.initializer: = "Regardless of how many items or bots are present when saving, " + "there will always be at least the items or bots specifically placed in the scene before playing. " + "If you would like the bot/item count to be completely accurate on load, put no items/bots in the scene " + "and place them while playing."

briefdescription.para: The section in the editor allowing designers to easily identify and adjust Item values relavent to their tasks.
The section in the editor allowing designers to easily identify and adjust Bot values relavent to their tasks.

Unity's OnValidate Hook is used to allow Edit Time changes to item/bot colors. Using this hook allows the desired fucntionality to effect only the materals used whereas the [ExecuteInEditMode] tag would cause all functionality to work in Edit Time, creating mass chaos.
Enusure everything that needs to be setup for first initialization is ready to go.
Initialize values for all elements of the game, any elements requiring pre initialization steps should occure in Awake.

Unity's Update hook is used to select the appropriate logic for the game's current state. Different state's represent different phases of the program. For example, state 0 could be the splash screen and main menu. State 1 is where gameplay happens. Additional states could be for Game Over conditions, pause conditions, or any other situation where the core gameplay shouldn't run. For this demo, only the gameplay state is used.
Used to start saving Player/Item/Bot amount and locations before the application quits.
Set's the games new state and initializes any setup required before Update runs that state's logic.

parameterdescription.para: The state the game will enter.

briefdescription.para: This will add a single new Item adhering to the IVBHObject contract and place it approriatley in the scene.
This will add a single new Bot adhering to the IVBHObject contract and place it approriatley in the scene.
This will remove the last Item adhering to the IVBHObject contract from the scene, and all appropriate places in code.
This will remove the last Bot adhering to the IVBHObject contract from the scene, and all appropriate places in code.
Removes any null VBHObjects from the vBHObject List and then resumes the nearest item/bot search after cleanup.

simplesect.para: WaitForEndOfFrame - The signal that the frame has ended, allowing code execution of the coroutine to resume.

briefdescription.para: Iterates over the VBHObjects list and returns a reference the the VBHO closest to the Player. This is using a bubble sort that could be optimized by replacing with a KD-Tree given more time. As part of the sorting task, this function is also making decisions about which shared material the VBHObjects should have. This is done here to reduce the amount of times a foreach loop is required. Additionally, this search is done in a coroutine to keep the main thread free to process core gameplay functionality. It should help with performance. The "yield return null" is placed such that the each iteration of the while loop will wait for a new frame to execute. This means the loop runs slower, but it's not noticable to the user and evens performance in other areas.

simplesect.para: null - The signal to wait until the next frame to continue the while loop.

briefdescription.para: Calls IVBHObject to generate Items. This is public so that the load system can access it when restoring Item amount and locations.
Calls IVBHObject to generate Bots. This is public so that the load system can access it when restoring Bot amount and locations.

The GameControl class is the business logic for this example. It controls the behavior of the Main scene's assets. It makes decisions by monitoring user input and environment conditions such as proximity of player to other assets.
